alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 02 at 1:33AM MST until December 02 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE NORTHEAST PLAINS AND HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITIES... .A disturbance passing through the central Rockies today will bring very strong southwest to west winds down to the surface over northeast New Mexico. Although minimum humidities are marginal, high temperatures will be about 10 to 15 degrees warmer than normal and wind gusts to 60 to 70 mph are possible. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 8 AM this morning to 5 PM MST this afternoon. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands especially from the I-25 Corridor eastward across the Northeast Plains from 8 AM this morning to 5 PM MST this afternoon. Winds are expected to taper off and become northerly 15-25 mph this evening as a cold front moves into the region. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 25 to 40 mph with gusts to around 60 to 70 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from around 15 to 20 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
